thread.title: Australia most tourism competitive country in Asia-Pacific regionTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Australia most tourism competitive country in Asia-Pacific regionTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Australia most tourism competitive country in Asia-Pacific regionTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Australia most tourism competitive country in Asia-Pacific region Published on : Saturday, September 5, 2015
According to Travel and Tourism Competitive Index 2015, Australia ranks 7th overall and top in the Asia-Pacific region. As per the Index report, Australia has identified tourism as one of four national investment priorities.
With attractions from the Great Barrier Reef to Kangaroo Island and the largest number of World Heritage natural sites, it ranks 2nd globally on natural resources.
It is also one of the top three destinations for leisure and entertainment, according to digital demand.
The TTCI reports says that Australia has made significant progress on visa requirements (49th), including an expansion of the online visa application system and self-processing border entry facilities for U.S. and U.K. e-passport holders.
It remains strong in its openness of bilateral air service agreements (5th) and air transport infrastructure (4th), though it needs further investment in ground and port infrastructure (57th) and tourism infrastructure (29th) to reach its potential.
The country should also consider tackling issues related to price competitiveness (138th) and human resources (49th), where access to the international talent pool is limited (134th) and hiring and firing practices are somewhat rigid (133rd), suggests the Index report.
